item.title: NYS Taxation & Finance Tabling | Nov. 18
item.description: The New York State Department of Taxation and Finance will be in the RPI Student Union on Tuesday, November 18th from 11:00am – 2:00pm. Stop by to learn more about the career opportunities available, including the Data Analyst position and other potential openings across the department. This is a great opportunity to meet with a representative, ask questions, and gain insight into the department’s career paths, organizational culture, and the important work they do serving New York State.

item.title: Altium Designer Certification Workshop, Saturday, November 15th
item.description: The Mercer X Lab, in collaboration with the Future Semiconductor Transitions Program, is offering a remote Altium Designer certification course on Saturday, November 15th, 2025. The 6-8 hour long workshop begins at 10:00 a.m. EST. Click the Prepare for an Altium Workshop Mercer X Education Module to REGISTER or email sawyes@rpi.edu. Participants earn an official Altium Certificate and a Mercer XLab PCB Design Badge when completed. An optional design challenge follows the workshop!

item.title: iEAR Presents! “The Story of Plastic” Screening and Panel Discussion | Nov. 15
item.description: As part of our Water Justice Lab End of Season Celebration, join us 11/15 at 7pm at the Sanctuary for Independent Media for a screening of the documentary “The Story of Plastic.” This sweeping look at the human-made crisis of plastic pollution and the worldwide effect it has on planetary and human health will be followed by an interdisciplinary panel discussion.

item.title: Water Justice Lab End-of-Season Celebration
item.description: Join Riverkeeper and NATURE Lab along with our community science volunteers, fellows, family and friends to celebrate the 6th season of Water Justice Lab. Activities include researcher and youth fellow presentations and a community meal followed by a film screening of “The Story of Plastic” and panel. Open House: 3319 6th Ave, Troy; Screening: 3361 6th Ave, Troy

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop- Book Discussion-“Powered by Me: From Burned Out to Fully Charged at Work and in Life” – Virtual Class
item.description: Join an instructor-led discussion of Powered by Me: From Burned Out to Fully Charged at Work and in Life by Neha Sangwan (Available in Percipio). Burnout is an energy crisis across five key dimensions—physical, mental, emotional, social, and spiritual. Together, we’ll explore how chronic stress depletes our energy, erodes our relationships, and diminishes our sense of purpose. Through guided conversation and reflection, participants will uncover practical strategies to restore balance,…

item.title: Fall 2025 End of Term Course Surveys in HelioCampus: Adding Additional Questions to a Course Section (Faculty/Instructor Training)
item.description:
Date: Monday, November 17, 2025 1:30 PM - 2:00 PM - This webinar offers faculty/instructors of course sections to add additional questions to their student end of term course evaluations. This is an optional process and only needed if instructors wanted to add other questions than what is on the institute course evaluation.
